questions.Q: The kinetic energy of a body of mass $$m$$ and speed $$v$$ is given by $$E_k=\frac{1}{2}mv^2$$. If the speed of a car is doubled, its kinetic energy increases by a factor of:
questions.E: When $$v_1=2v$$ the kinetic energy becomes $$E_{k1}=\frac{1}{2}mv_1^2=\frac{1}{2}m(2v)^2=4\times\frac{1}{2}mv^2=4\times E_k$$ So, that means, the energy will be 4 times larger than the initial value.

questions.Q: The period of a pendulum of length $$L$$ is given by $$T=2\pi \sqrt{\frac{L}{g}}$$ where $$g$$ is the acceleration of gravity. If the period doubles the length changes by a factor equals to
questions.E: When $$T_1=2T$$ we have  $$=2\pi \sqrt{\frac{L_1}{g}}=2\times 2\pi \sqrt{\frac{L}{g}}$$, i.e.,  $$\sqrt{L_1}=2\sqrt{L}\,\therefore\, L_1=4L$$ So, that means, the length becomes 4 times larger than the initial value

questions.Q: The electric force between two charges $$q_1$$ and $$q_2$$ a distance $$r$$ apart is given by $$F=k\frac{q_1q_2}{r^2}$$ where $$k$$ is a constant. If both charges double the force between them changes by a factor of:
questions.E: When $$q_1^\prime=2q_1$$ and $$q_2^\prime=2q_2$$ we have  $$=F^\prime=k\frac{q_1^\prime q_2^\prime}{r^2}=k\frac{(2q_1)(2q_2)}{r^2}=4\times k\frac{q_1q_2}{r^2}=4\times F$$ So, that means, the force will be 4 times larger than the initial value.

questions.Q: The electric force between two charges $$q_1$$ and $$q_2$$ a distance $$r$$ apart is given by $$F=k\frac{q_1q_2}{r^2}$$ where $$k$$ is a constant. If the distance betwwen the charges is halved the force between them changes by a factor of:
questions.E: If the distance between the charges is halved, with no changes of the charges, the new distance becomes $$\frac{r}{2}$$,  the acting force between the same charges is $$F^\prime=k\frac{q_1 q_2}{(\frac{r}{2})^2}= 4\times k\frac{q_1 q_2}{r^2}=4\times F$$ So, that means, the force will be 4 times larger than the initial value.

questions.Q: The magnitude of the gravtational force between two masses $$m_1$$ and $$m_2$$ a distance $$r$$ apart is given by $$F=G\frac{m_1m_2}{r^2}$$ where $$G$$ is a constant. If the distance betwwen the masses is quadrupled the force between them changes by a factor of:
questions.E: If the distance between the massess is quadrupled, with no changes of the masses, the new distance becomes $$4r$$, the acting force between the same masses is $$F^\prime=G\frac{m_1 m_2}{(4r)^2}= \frac{1}{16}\times G\frac{m_1 m_2}{r^2}=\frac{1}{16}\times F$$ So, that means, the force will be 16 times smaller than the initial value.

questions.Q: The period of a planet around the sun is given by $$T^2=qR^3$$ where $$q$$ is a constant and R is the mean distance from the sun to the planet. A planet orbits the sun at a distance from it that is thrice the distance of earth to the sun. If the earth's period is one year, the period of the planet is:
questions.E: If the distance between the the sun an earth is doubled we have  $$T_1^2=q(3R)^3=q(3)^3R^3=27kR^3=27T^2\,\therefore\,T_1=\sqrt{27}T=\sqrt{27}(1\,\text{year})=5.2\,\text{years}$$ So, that means, It will take the planet 5.2 years to make a complete revolution around the sun.

questions.Q: The power dissipated by a resistance is given by $$ P = Ri^2 $$ where $$R$$ is its electrical resistance and $$i$$ is the electrical current passing through it. If the current value is doubled, the power increases by a factor of:
questions.E: If the current is doubled, i.e., $$i_=2i$$ the power becomes $$ P_1 = Ri_1^2=R(2i)^2=4Ri^2=4\times P$$ So, that means, the power dissipated is 4 times larger than the initial value.

questions.Q: The power dissipated by a resistance is given by $$ P = Ri^2 $$ where $$R$$ is its electrical resistance and $$i$$ is the electrical current passing through it. If the resistance value is doubled keeping the same current, the power increases by a factor of:
questions.E: If the resistance is doubled, i.e., $$R_1=2R$$ the power becomes $$ P_1 = R_1i^2=(2R)i^2=2Ri^2=2\times P$$ So, that means, the power dissipated is 2 times larger than the initial value.

questions.Q: The time it takes for a stone to fall from the top of a building to the ground is given by $$t=\sqrt {\frac{2h}{g}} $$ where $$h$$ is the height of the building y $$g$$ is the acceleration due to gravity. If the stone is dropped from the top of a building that is half the height, the time is reduced by a factor of:
questions.E: If the heigth is halved, i.e., $$h_1=\frac{h}{2}$$ the time becomes $$ t_1 =\sqrt{\frac{2h_1}{g}}=\sqrt {\frac{2\frac{h}{2}}{g}}=\frac{1}{\sqrt{2}}\sqrt{\frac{2h}{g}}=\frac{1}{\sqrt{2}}\times t=\frac{\sqrt{2}}{2}\times t$$ So, that means, the time is $$\frac{\sqrt{2}}{2}$$  times smaller than the initial value.

questions.Q: The time it takes for a truck starting from rest and moving with constant acceleration $$a$$ to travel a distance $$x$$ is given by $$t=\sqrt {\frac{2x}{a}}$$. If the distance is doubled the time is increased by a factor of:
questions.E: If the distance is doubled, i.e., $$x_1=2x$$ the time becomes $$ t_1 =\sqrt{\frac{2x_1}{a}}=\sqrt {\frac{2(2x)}{a}}=\sqrt{2}\sqrt{\frac{2x}{a}}=\sqrt{2}\times t$$ So, that means, the time is $$\sqrt{2}$$  times larger than the initial value.

questions.Q: The electric force between two charges $$q_1$$ and $$q_2$$ a distance $$r$$ apart is given by $$F=k\frac{q_1q_2}{r^2}$$ where $$k$$ is a constant. If the distance betwwen the charges is halved and both charges are tripled the force between them changes by a factor of:
questions.E: If the distance between the charges is halved, and the charges are doubled we have $$r_1=\frac{r}{2}$$ and $$q_1^\prime=3q_1$$ and $$q_2^\prime=3q_2$$, the acting force between the same charges becomes $$F^\prime=k\frac{q_1^\prime q_2^\prime}{r_1^2}=k\frac{(3q_1)(3q_2)}{(\frac{r}{2})^2}= 36\times k\frac{q_1 q_2}{r^2}=36\times F$$ So, that means, the force will be 36 times larger than the initial value.

questions.Q: A capacitor is an electronic device that is used to store electric energy. The energy stored is given by $$U_e=\frac{1}{2}CV^2$$ where $$C$$ is a constant and $$V$$ is the potential difference.  If the potencial difference is halved the energy changes by a factor of:
questions.E: If the potential difference is halved, i.e., $$V_1=\frac{V}{2}$$ the energy stored by the capacitor becomes $$U_e^\prime=\frac{1}{2}CV_1^2=\frac{1}{2}C(\frac{1}{2})^2 = \frac{1}{4}\times \frac{1}{2}CV^2=\frac{1}{4}\times U_e$$ So, that means, the energy stored will be $$\frac{1}{4}$$ times smaller than the initial value.

questions.Q: If all the sides of the parallepiped are doubled. The surface area of the parallepiped changes by a factor of:
questions.E: The inital area of the parallelepiped is $$A=2[ac+ab+bc]$$. When the sides are double, i.e., $$a_1=2a\text{,}\,b_1=2b\text{,}\,c_1=2c$$ the area becomes $$A_1=2[a_1c_1+a_1b_1+b_1c_1]=2[(2a)(2c)+(2a)(2b)+(2b)(2c)]=2[4ac+4ab+4bc]=4\times 2[ac+ab+bc]=4A$$. So, that means, the surface area will be 4 times larger than the initial value.
